definition: to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]

sentences.english: Thus attacked, the Japanese would be afraid to split up.
sentences.chinese: 一遭到這樣的伏擊，日軍就龜縮作一因。

sentences.english: While you still have the option to wall yourself in and turtle, it is much less effective.
sentences.chinese: 當你依然使用龜縮戰術的話，效率會很低下。

sentences.english: Do not you finally prefer that the turtle shrunk?
If you're cowardly again, I'll marry your grandpa.
sentences.chinese: 你要是再龜縮的話，我就要嫁給你爺爺了。

sentences.english: If he waffles and folds, China will win again.
sentences.chinese: 如果他繼續龜縮不前的話，中國則又將取勝。

sentences.english: The enemy was holed up in a few isolated strongholds.
sentences.chinese: 敵人龜縮在幾個孤立的據點裏。

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to whisper to one another's ear
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
lit. to drive a duck onto a perch (idiom)/fig. to push sb to do sth way beyond their ability
